<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sort all objects for short/paired displacements, which should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sufficient as it seems like all frame objects typically are within the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// long displacement range.  Sorting works by computing the &quot;density&quot; as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Count / ObjectSize. The comparisons of two such fractions are refactored</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by multiplying both sides with A.ObjectSize &#42; B.ObjectSize, in order to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// eliminate the (fp) divisions.  A higher density object needs to go after</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the list in order for it to end up lower on the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CmpD12 = &#91;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SZFrameSortingObj &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SZFrameSortingObj &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Put all invalid and variable sized objects at the end.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.IsValid || !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.IsValid)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.IsValid;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectSize || !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectSize)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectSize &gt; 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t ADensityCmp = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.D12Count &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t BDensityCmp = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.D12Count &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ADensityCmp != BDensityCmp)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ADensityCmp &lt; BDensityCmp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.DPairCount &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectSize &lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.DPairCount &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::stable&#95;sort(SortingObjects.begin(), SortingObjects.end(), CmpD12);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now modify the original list to represent the final order that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we want.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Obj : SortingObjects) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// All invalid items are sorted at the end, so it&#39;s safe to stop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Obj.IsValid)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal">    ObjectsToAllocate&#91;Idx++&#93; = Obj.ObjectIndex;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/systemzframelowering/#a46fc8db3cce495e6eb3bd900d6027430"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/systemzframelowering/#a46fc8db3cce495e6eb3bd900d6027430">SystemZFrameLowering::hasReservedCallFrame</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The ELF ABI requires us to allocate 160 bytes of stack space for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// callee, with any outgoing stack arguments being placed above that. It</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// seems better to make that area a permanent feature of the frame even if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we&#39;re using a frame pointer. Similarly, 64-bit XPLINK requires 96 bytes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of stack space for the register save area.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1469"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Although the XPLINK specifications for AMODE64 state that minimum size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1470"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the param area is minimum 32 bytes and no rounding is otherwise</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1471"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// specified, we round this area in 64 bytes increments to be compatible</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1475"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1476"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Add frame values with positive object offsets. Since the displacement from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1477"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the SP/FP is calculated by ObjectOffset + StackSize + Bias, object offsets</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1478"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with positive values are in the caller&#39;s stack frame. We need to include</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1479"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that since it is accessed by displacement to SP/FP.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1480"><Highlight kind="normal">  int64&#95;t LargestArgOffset = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#ae70474766f2a88bab5b2b77bcb22212b">getObjectIndexBegin</a>(); <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> != 0; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#adf98860d7f42290f873c82a981eb0ea6">getObjectOffset</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &gt;= 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><Highlight kind="normal">      int64&#95;t ObjOffset = MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#adf98860d7f42290f873c82a981eb0ea6">getObjectOffset</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) + MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a9284fd53296d2a2f8ae654d000971000">getObjectSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><Highlight kind="normal">      LargestArgOffset = std::max(ObjOffset, LargestArgOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t MaxReach = (StackSize + Regs.getCallFrameSize() +</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><Highlight kind="normal">                       Regs.getStackPointerBias() + LargestArgOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1490"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1491"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a87e65296f2a6d9570117a852af342764">isUInt&lt;12&gt;</a>(MaxReach)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1492"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We may need register scavenging slots if some parts of the frame</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1504"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Regs =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1506"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t StackSize = MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a14c39a24bf6ebbe339ae8a453c7fdd11">getStackSize</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1508"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (StackSize == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1513"><Highlight kind="normal">  MFFrame.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#ae4d51e9e70d6a7fb366f2a09d10a0945">setStackSize</a>(StackSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1514"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1515"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We now know the stack size. Update the stack objects for the register save</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1516"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// area now. This has no impact on the stack frame layout, as this is already</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1520"><Highlight kind="normal">       ++FrameIdx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
